paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the KCNH2 gene, including penetrance data.

patients.phenotype: type 2 long QT syndrome (LQT2) with seizure phenotype

individual_records.phenotype_details: seizure phenotype reported in LQT2 patients
individual_records.evidence_sentence: In particular, a seizure phenotype was reported in about 30% of unrelated LQTS patients carrying pathogenic variants in the KCNH2 gene.
In particular, a seizure phenotype was reported in about 30% of unrelated LQTS patients carrying pathogenic variants in the KCNH2 gene.
In particular, a seizure phenotype was reported in about 30% of unrelated LQTS patients carrying pathogenic variants in the KCNH2 gene.

functional_data.summary: In vitro functional analyses of all these variants showed a loss of hERG potassium channel function with a reduction of the current, suggesting a dominant negative effect.

variants.additional_notes: Variants associated with LQT2 and seizure activity.
key_quotes: In particular, a seizure phenotype was reported in about 30% of unrelated LQTS patients carrying pathogenic variants in the KCNH2 gene.
In vitro functional analyses of all these variants showed a loss of hERG potassium channel function with a reduction of the current, suggesting a dominant negative effect.

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted data is based on the information provided in the main text.
